title: Novel routes to nano-materials for Li-ion batteries

author: Mario Valvo, Delft Research Centre for Sustainable Energy, Delft University of Technology (TU Delft)

segmentation: Good afternoon ladies and gentlemen, my name is Maria Album and today I'm going to present you the work that we are carrying out at our Department within the section of nanostructure materials and in collaboration with the European network.
Store the outline is the following.
First, I'll briefly discuss the state of the art of lithium ion batteries and we will see why this technologies is interesting and which kind of development we can expect in the near future.
Then I will start talking about Metallica Noyd known particles as alternative negative electrodes inside the leak in my own battery.
I'll show you also an overview of the techniques that we are developing at our Department in order to achieve the production of this kind of negative electrodes for lithium ion cells.
In the Meanwhile I will show you also some examples of the synthesized materials which have been produced by means of these two techniques, and finally we will have some conclusion.
It looks, but when we talk about lithium ion batteries, everybody starts thinking about mobile phones or laptops.
And these are indeed good example which showed that this technology is promising the fast growing market of portable electronics requires.
Nowadays all wesir performances combined with reduced volumes and weights, and we see that up to now, the lithium ion technology managed to fulfill this request.
Nevertheless, we think that is still enough room for improvement.
Of this technology, especially if we would like to power electric or hybrid electric vehicles, which will require much air performance in terms of both gravimetric and volumetric energy densities.

For this reason, it is a disclosure that using nanoparticles and in general non structured materials can be really a feasible way in order to achieve these goals and also to solve some issues which are related, for example, with the safety and the reliability of this technology.
Here are shown some good points while going now can be really an effective way to improve the performances of both positive and negative electrodes inside the lithium ion batteries.
In particular, today we will focus our attention on the improvement of negative electrodes.
Alternative negative electrodes in lithium ion.

We have obviously pros.

Lloyd and this Metallica Lloyd upon repeated cycling will simply expand and contract giving us severe volume change which will lead finally to electric tracking with loss of.
Electrical contact between the particles and having finally Porsche.
Like a life for ourselves.
At the volume, two different approaches have been proposed in order to circumvent this problem, namely the use of composite materials and try to reduce the size of the particles.

Both approaches have good points, and we think, for example, that using composite materials we can buffer, for example leaking growing phase, trying to surround it with a less inert matrix, which can act as a buffer for the face that is growing and expanding at the same time.
If we manage to scale down the absolute size of the particles.

You expect that we will reduce their absolute volume change, thus leading to increase mechanical stability and finally going none or means also shortening the diffusion length for the lithium ions, improving, deleting modeling both these two approach and eventually their own combination suggests that Metallica knowledge nanoparticles can be a feasible way in order to improve the characteristic of this alternative electrodes.
For this purpose, at our Department we are working on the development of two different.
Synthesis techniques, both based on optimization by electrical means, and these are there.
This park discharge generator and electrostatic spray, reductive precipitation.
